mchorse.mappet.api.scripts.user.mappet

Interface IMappetStates


  • public interface IMappetStates
    This interface represents Mappet states. Server (IScriptServer), players (IScriptPlayer) and NPCs (IScriptNpc) can have states. 
    
    function main(c)
    {
        var states = c.getServer().getStates();

        // Do something with global states...
    }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double add(java.lang.String id, double value)
      Add some value to existing state by ID.
      void clear()
      Remove all states.
      double getNumber(java.lang.String id)
      Get a numeric value of a state by given ID.
      java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String id)
      Get a string value of a state by given ID.
      boolean has(java.lang.String id)
      Check whether state by given ID exists.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keys()
      Get IDs of all states.
      void reset(java.lang.String id)
      Removes a state by given ID.
      void setNumber(java.lang.String id, double value)
      Set numeric value to existing state by ID.
      void setString(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String value)
      Set string value to existing state by ID.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        double add(java.lang.String id,
           double value)
        Add some value to existing state by ID. 
        
    var states = c.getServer().getStates();

    states.add("total_spending", 20);
    c.send("Total spending is now " + states.getNumber("total_spending"));
        Returns:
        original value plus the provided value

      • setNumber

        void setNumber(java.lang.String id,
               double value)
        Set numeric value to existing state by ID. 
        
    var states = c.getServer().getStates();

    states.setNumber("total_spending", 1000000001);
    c.send("Total spending is now " + states.getNumber("total_spending"));

      • setString

        void setString(java.lang.String id,
               java.lang.String value)
        Set string value to existing state by ID. 
        
    var states = c.getSubject().getStates();

    states.setString("name", "Jeff");
    c.getSubject().send("Your name is " + states.getString("name"));

      • getNumber

        double getNumber(java.lang.String id)
        Get a numeric value of a state by given ID. 
        
    var states = c.getServer().getStates();

    c.send("Total spending is " + states.getNumber("total_spending"));
        Returns:
        state value, or 0 if no state found

      • getString

        java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String id)
        Get a string value of a state by given ID. 
        
    var states = c.getSubject().getStates();

    c.send("Your RPG class is: " + states.getString("class"));
        Returns:
        state value, or empty string if no state found

      • reset

        void reset(java.lang.String id)
        Removes a state by given ID. 
        
    var states = c.getServer().getStates();

    // The city has been defaulted
    states.remove("total_spendings");

      • clear

        void clear()
        Remove all states. 
        
    var states = c.getServer().getStates();

    // Game over
    states.clear();

      • has

        boolean has(java.lang.String id)
        Check whether state by given ID exists. 
        
    var states = c.getSubject().getStates();
    var name = states.has("name") ? states.getString("name") : "Jeff";

    c.getSubject().send("Your name is " + name);

      • keys

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keys()
        Get IDs of all states. 
        
    var states = c.getSubject().getStates().keys();

    for each (var key in states)
    {
        c.send("Server has state: " + key);
    }
